sourceText: Plotinus, Enneads; Proclus, Elements of Theology; Iamblichus, De Mysteriis
note: The Neoplatonic celestial hierarchy. Nine levels from Moon to Source. The seven planetary spheres are traversed in the soul's ascent, followed by the Nous (fixed stars/firmament) and the Source (Primum Mobile / The One).

Moon.imbalance: Inconsistency, illusion, dreams, shadows, mirrors, and reflection

Mercury.description: Intellect and speech, reason and communication, awakening of thought

Venus.description: Love and attraction, beauty and desire, drawn to union and the erotic
Venus.imbalance: Attachment, lust, and pleasure at the expense of truth

Sun.description: Illumination and clarity, nous and wisdom, charity and the good-oriented

Mars.description: Courage, assertion, action, conflict, and struggle
Mars.virtue: Nobility, strength with gentleness, discernment for the good

Jupiter.description: Mercy, justice, wisdom, magnanimity, and cosmic order

Saturn.description: Form and formlessness, individuated soul, and mortality

Nous — Fixed Stars.description: The archetypes of creation, cosmic pattern, and direct knowledge

Source — Primum Mobile.description: The outer heavens, realm of the angels, pure will of God
